Vitamin D deficiency common problem patient COPD.. Objective : To assess effect vitamin D supplementation exacerbation rate patient COPD vitamin D deficiency . Study design : Randomized , multi-center , double-blind , placebo-controlled intervention study . Study population : 240 patient age 40 year old COPD vitamin D deficiency ( 25-hydroxyvitamin D concentration ( 25OHD ) < 50 nmol/l ) COPD exacerbation . An exacerbation define sustained worsen respiratory symptom 48 hour require oral corticosteroid , antibiotic combination treatment initiated physician . Respiratory symptom include least one Anthonisen criterion ( increase dyspnoea , sputum volume purulence ) . Patients severe vitamin D deficiency ( 25OHD < 15 nmol/l ) , know osteoporosis and/or use vitamin D supplementation > 400 IU per day exclude . Intervention : Participants randomly allocate receive vitamin D3 16800 IU placebo orally week 1 year . Main study parameters/endpoints : The primary endpoint exacerbation rate .
